oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wyley McPherson Interview by John Lomax III
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Wyley McPherson by John Lomax III. The interview takes place on 08-05-1982
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wyley McPherson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:54) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson about his biographical information - where he was born, how was he was raised, and how he got to Nashville. (1:57) -- Wyley McPherson explains that he learned to sing in church. His father was a baptist minister. (2:36) -- Wyley McPherson mentions that he's been in Nashville for 12 years. (2:51) -- Wyley McPherson mentions that he's had songs recorded by Johnny Cash, Tammy Wynette, George Jones, Loretta Lynn, and Sonny James, to name a few. (3:18) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson about his other endeavors than songwriting. Wyley McPherson explains that he's been in the publishing business. (4:15) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson about George Jones. (5:04) -- John Lomax explains who reads artists' bios. (6:52) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson (Paul Richey) why he chose the name 'Wyley McPherson' to write under. (9:45) -- Wyley McPherson describes the stage for his upcoming tour. (11:43) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson whether he should include names of songs Wyley McPherson has published. (12:55) -- (Paul Richey) Wyley McPherson describes acts who have used his studio. Wyley mentions Willie Nelson, George Jones, and Tammy Wynette as people who have used his studio. (15:01) -- Wyley McPherson discusses the importance of fan service - giving tours to fans of his bus, giving autographs, and meeting the artist (Wyley). (19:37) -- Wyley McPherson mentions the importance of sending free records to smaller radio stations. (21:24) -- John Lomax asks Wyley McPherson about emphasizing his small-town roots in his article. (22:22) -- Wyley McPherson mentions that he lived in Memphis for fifteen years recording for Sun Records.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Richey, Paul; McPherson, Wyley;
